docs.lead_paragraph: The Platte Argus of the 22d announces the arrival at Weston of Mr. DAVIDSON, with advices to the 14th ult. from the Utah Expedition. The troops were engaged in making themselves comfortable for the Winter. Their health was good. There is no news from Capt. MARCY, who had been dispatched to New-Mexico for salt.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Canada, the news by which, as telegraphed from Halifax, we published yesterday morning, arrived at Boston yesterday afternoon, and her mails were dispatched over the NewHaven Railroad and arrived in this City about 1 o'clock this morning. We find nothing of importance in our tiles not given in the telegraphic summary.

headline.main: PARIS GOSSIP.; SKating in the Bois de Boulogne--Imperial Festivities--Funeral of Rachel--American Reunions--Miscellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: During the Summer season the promenade of the fashionable world is the Bois de Boulogne, the Champs Elysees having been given up to the carriage less million. But no one ever dreamed, perhaps, that the wood was to become, in the dead of Winter, a place of as much attraction as in the heat of Summer.
